snippet: A federal judge on Friday declared unconstitutional the state’s ultrasound requirement for women seeking abortions, saying it violated the First Amendment by requiring doctors to display a fetal image and describe it even to women who covered their...
abstract: Federal Judge Catherine C Eagles declares unconstitutional North Carolina's ultrasound requirement for women seeking abortions; says it violates the First Amendment by requiring doctors to display a fetal image and describe it even to women who covered their eyes and ears
lead_paragraph: A federal judge on Friday declared unconstitutional the state’s ultrasound requirement for women seeking abortions, saying it violated the First Amendment by requiring doctors to display a fetal image and describe it even to women who covered their eyes and ears.

headline.main: North Carolina: Judge Blocks Ultrasound Requirement
headline.print_headline: North Carolina: Judge Blocks Ultrasound Requirement
